full_summary:
**W2604-23JP04: Request for Standing Offer for Non-Destructive Testing Services**

**Background Information**
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites proposals from qualified Offerors to provide Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) services for the Department of National Defence (DND) at 15 Wing Moose Jaw in Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan. The services are required to inspect parts from the CT-114 Tutor aircraft.

**Bid Submission Details**

*   Tender Closing Date: **15 August 2023 at 2:00 PM EDT (New Tame Time)**
*   Submission Requirements: Please submit all required supporting documentation and bid submission within the deadline to be considered responsive.
*   Location: All bid submissions must be submitted to the PSPC by the deadline.

**Notice**
Canada is seeking offers from qualified Offerors to provide mandatory NDT support for DND. The inspections will be done "as and when requested" basis at 15 Wing Moose Jaw in Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan. The Offeror must have the necessary expertise and equipment to perform the required inspections.

**Notice URL**
The complete notice for this tender is posted on the Ariba Discovery website: <http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17003451?extsite=MTcwMDM0NTFfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==>

**Points of Contact**
For more information about this tender, please contact: Lyland Wiebe, PSPC/SPAC, at lyland.wiebe@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

**Attachments**
There are no attachments available for this notice. 

Please submit your offerings through Ariba Discovery prior to the new deadline. We look forward to your participation in this request for a Standing Offer. 

**Please let me know if you want me to revise anything**

The rewritten text aims to provide a clear and concise version of the original text, including the essential information required for the submission process. Please review and let me know if there are any modifications to be made.

The most critical changes made include:

*   Improved formatting using markdown.
*   A more formal and professional tone for clarity.
*   Specific bid submission details and a reminder for the new closing time.
*   Emphasis on the required qualifications and expertise for the Offeror.
*   Clear points of contact and attachment information for bid submissions.
